{{Infobox military unit|unit_name = 55th Army|dates = 1941–1943|country = {{flag|Soviet Union}}|branch = [[Red Army]]|type = Combined arms|command_structure = [[Leningrad Front]]|battles = [[World War II]] *[[Sinyavino Offensive (1942)|Sinyavino Offensive]] *[[Lyuban Offensive Operation]] *[[Battle of Krasny Bor]]}}The '''55th Army''' was a field army of the Red Army during World War II. It was part of the [[Leningrad Front]] and was formed on 1 September 1941. The army fought in the [[Sinyavino Offensive (1942)|Sinyavino Offensive]], [[Lyuban Offensive Operation]] and the [[Battle of Krasny Bor]]. On 25 December 1943, it was combined with the [[67th Army (Soviet Union)|67th Army]]. <ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title = 55-я армия|url = http://samsv.narod.ru/Arm/a55/arm.html|website = samsv.narod.ru|accessdate = 2016-01-02|language = Russian|trans-title = 55th Army}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title = 55-я АРМИЯ|url = http://bdsa.ru/index2.php?option=com_content&task=emailform&id=2826&itemid=143|website = bdsa.ru|accessdate = 2016-01-02|language = Russian|trans-title = 55th Army}}</ref>
== History == [[File:RIAN archive 58228 Leningrad Front Soldiers Before Offensive.jpg|thumb|Soldiers on the Leningrad Front in September 1941]] The 55th Army was formed on 1 September 1941 as part of the [[Leningrad Front]]. It was formed from the Task Force of Major General [[Ivan Gavrilovich Lazarev|I.G. Lazarev]] and the [[19th Rifle Corps]] headquarters. The army fought in the [[Leningrad Strategic Defensive|Leningrad Strategic Defensive Operation]]. At the time, it was the largest of the four armies defending Leningrad, with up to half of the active formations.{{Sfn|Forczyk|2009|p=23}}Using the defenses of the Slutsk-Kolpino Fortified Area, the army defended Leningrad's southern approaches in the area of [[Kolpino, Saint Petersburg|Kolpino]], [[Krasnogvardeysk]], [[Zaborje]], [[Vyritsa]], the [[Izhora River]] and the [[Tosna River]]. Its units stopped the German advance{{Sfn|Kirchubel|2012|p=75}} at [[Putrolovo]], Bolshoye Kuzmino, Novaya and Verkhneye Kuzmino. From October 1941 to December 1942, the army carried out local offensives to improve its positions. In November, [[Vladimir Petrovich Sviridov|Vladimir Sviridov]] replaced Lazarev.<ref name=":1" /> On 20 December the army began an attack at [[Mga]], later joined by the [[54th Army (Soviet Union)|54th Army]], to distract from the upcoming Lyuban Offensive Operation but was unsuccessful.{{Sfn|Glantz|1989|p=70}}On 23 July 1942 a rifle division and a tank brigade of the army attacked the [[SS Polizei Division]] south of Kolpino. The attack made some gains.{{Sfn|Forczyk|2009|p=58}}On 26 September elements of two of the army's rifle divisions were sent across the Neva to reinforce the encircled [[8th Army (Soviet Union)|8th Army]]. After losing two of three bridgeheads, the 55th Army units withdrew across the Neva.{{Sfn|Forczyk|2009|p=62}}
=== Battle of Krasny Bor === In February 1943, the army fought in the [[Battle of Krasny Bor]]. The army was the left pincer of the offensive and was to attack out of Kolpino and destroy the [[Blue Division]] at [[Krasny Bor, Tosnensky District, Leningrad Oblast|Krasny Bor]], then advance southeast to [[Tosno]]. A division-size attack on 8 February forced several Blue Division outposts back. On 10 February, the 55th Army attacked simultaneously with the [[54th Army (Soviet Union)|54th Army]]. The 55th Army attacked along a front of 14 kilometers, concentrating three rifle division and a tank brigade against one regiment of the Blue Division. The Soviet troops broke through the Spanish line and the army's [[63rd Guards Rifle Division]] advanced into and captured Krasny Bor. On the army's left, its [[43rd Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|43rd Rifle Division]] attacked a regiment of the SS Polizei Division, but was unable to advance. German reinforcements arrived and formed a new defensive line south of Krasny Bor, stopping the advance of the 55th Army. The army brought up its tank units and resumed the offensive towards [[Mishkino, Leningrad Oblast|Mishkino]] on 17 February but was again repulsed by [[Tiger (tank)|Tiger tanks]] of [[Panzer-Abteilung 502]].{{Sfn|Forczyk|2016|p=71}} During the offensive, the army advanced five kilometers and suffered more than 10,000 casualties. The army inflicted 3,645 casualties on the [[Blue Division]]. On 19 March, the army attacked again in conjunction with the 8th Army, but was forced to retreat by counterattacks from [[27th SS Volunteer Division Langemarck|Legion Flandern]] and Panzer-Abteilung 502.{{Sfn|Forczyk|2009|p=|pp=76–81}} On 25 December 1943, the army was combined with the 67th Army.<ref name=":1" />
== Composition == On 1 September 1941, the army contained the following units.<ref name=":0" /> * [[70th Rifle Division]] * [[90th Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|90th Rifle Division]] * [[168th Rifle Division]] * [[237th Rifle Division]] * 1st People's Militia Division * 4th People's Militia Division * 2nd Rifle Regiment * Slutsk-Kolpino Fortified Area
